generif.text: USP1 deubiquitinates FANCD2 protein when cells exit S phase or recommence cycling after a DNA damage insult and may play a critical role in the Fanconi anemia pathway by recycling FANCD2.

USP1-regulated and damage-specific DNA-binding protein 1 (DDB1)-dependent mechanisms that are involved in the downregulation of activated CHK1 in human cells.
Studies indicate that USP1 and ELG1 as regulators of PCNA ubiquitylation.

USP1 levels were kept low in G1 to provide a permissive condition for inducing proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) monoubiquitination in response to ultraviolet (UV) damage before DNA replication.
Study shows that the deubiquitinating enzyme USP1 promotes ID protein stability and stem cell-like characteristics in osteosarcoma.
data identified a novel USP1-PHLPP1-Akt signaling axis, and decreased USP1 level in lung cancer cells may play an important role in lung cancer progress.
USP1 and UAF1 form a complex in the cytoplasm that subsequently translocates to the nucleus through import mediated by USP1 nuclear localization signals.

Our findings revealed an intriguing mechanism of regulating USP1 activity that combines phosphorylation of a key serine residue in USP1 and the specific interaction of USP1 with a WD40-repeat protein UAF1
Coimmunoprecipitation experiments indicated that human papillomavirus type 31 E1 assembles into a ternary complex with UAF1 and any one of these three USPs: USP1, USP12 and USP46.
USP1 phosphorylation at S313 is not critical for PCNA deubiquitination, neither for binding to UAF1 in a cellular environment.
USP1, p21 and Spartan are translesion DNA synthesis regulators. (Review)

Ubiquitination-specific proteases 1 (USP1)-mediated protein stabilization promotes glioblastoma (GBM) stem-like cells maintenance and treatment resistance, thereby providing a rationale for USP1 inhibition as a potential therapeutic approach against GBM.
No correlation was observed between the protein level of ubiquitin-specific protease 1 (USP1) and ubiquitinated PCNA in BAF180 expressing cells
analysis of the function and regulation of the USP1-UAF1 complex
Translational regulation of the mRNA encoding USP1 is involved in the DNA damage response as a determinant of cisplatin resistance.
High USP1 expression is associated with glioma.
USP1-UAF1 complex promotes homologous recombination repair via multiple mechanisms: through FANCD2 deubiquitination, as well as by interacting with RAD51AP1.
The results suggest that silencing USP1 inhibits cell proliferation and invasion in U2OS cells. Therefore, USP1 may provide a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of osteosarcoma.
Our preclinical studies provide the framework for clinical evaluation of USP1 inhibitors, alone or in combination, as a potential novel multiple myeloma therapy.
There is evidence that USP1/WDR48 complex promotes cancer stem cell conservation and regulation of DNA damage repair. [REVIEW]
These results outline a novel mechanism for the control of TBK1 activity and suggest USP1-UAF1 complex as a potential target for the prevention of viral diseases.
USP1 (ubiquitin specific peptidase 1) has been identified as a key player in the modulation of ULK1 K63-linked deubiquitination.
High USP1 expression is associated with Glioma Tumorigenesis.
USP1 and capital ER, Cyrilliccapital EN, Cyrillic domain of Bcr-Abl oncoprotein colocalize in a model chronic myeloid leukemia cell system.

Three crystal structures have been reported of a CRL2 substrate receptor, KLHDC2, in complex with the diglycine-ending C-end degrons of an early terminated selenoprotein, SelK, and the N-terminal proteolytic fragment of USP1.
USP1-mediated deubiquitination and stabilization of KPNA2 are revealed as the downstream events crucial for USP1-pro-metastatic function.
USP1 exhibits DNA-mediated activation at the replication fork, protects the fork, and promotes survival in BRCA1-deficient tumor cells.

In this report, the authors provide evidence that the previously described interaction between the viral E1 helicase and the cellular UAF1-USP1 deubiquitinating enzyme complex is required for the completion of the bidirectional theta replication of the human papilloma virus type 11 genome and the subsequent initiation of the unidirectional replication.

USP1 is phosphorylated by ATM and ATR and binds to Snail.  Knockout or pharmacological inhibition of USP1 increased platinum sensitivity and decreased metastatic dissemination in a Snail-dependent manner.
Inhibition of USP1, a new partner of Bcr-Abl, results in decrease of Bcr-Abl level in K562 cells.
Comprehensive analysis of ubiquitin-specific protease 1 reveals its importance in hepatocellular carcinoma.
Inhibition of USP1 induces apoptosis via ID1/AKT pathway in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia cells.
USP1-WDR48 deubiquitinase complex enhances TGF-beta induced epithelial-mesenchymal transition of TNBC cells via stabilizing TAK1.
Structural basis of FANCD2 deubiquitination by USP1-UAF1.
A new role of GRP75-USP1-SIX1 protein complex in driving prostate cancer progression and castration resistance.
Mutation of aspartic acid 199 in USP1 disrupts its deubiquitinating activity and impairs DNA repair.
USP1-dependent RPS16 protein stability drives growth and metastasis of human hepatocellular carcinoma cells.
USP1 Promotes GC Metastasis via Stabilizing ID2.
Ubiquitin-specific protease 1 overexpression indicates poor prognosis and promotes proliferation, migration, and invasion of gastric cancer cells.
USP1 inhibition suppresses the progression of osteosarcoma via destabilizing TAZ.
Inhibition of USP1 enhances anticancer drugs-induced cancer cell death through downregulation of survivin and miR-216a-5p-mediated upregulation of DR5.
Ubiquitinated PCNA Drives USP1 Synthetic Lethality in Cancer.
USP1-regulated reciprocal differentiation of Th17 cells and Treg cells by deubiquitinating and stabilizing TAZ.
USP1 promotes the aerobic glycolysis and progression of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia via PLK1/LDHA axis.
USP1 modulates hepatocellular carcinoma progression via the Hippo/TAZ axis.
USP1 promotes cholangiocarcinoma progression by deubiquitinating PARP1 to prevent its proteasomal degradation.
A genome-wide CRISPR screen identifies USP1 as a novel regulator of the mammalian circadian clock.
The UAF1-USP1 Deubiquitinase Complex Stabilizes cGAS and Facilitates Antiviral Responses.
USP1-dependent nucleolytic expansion of PRIMPOL-generated nascent DNA strand discontinuities during replication stress.
The P53-P21-RB1 pathway promotes BRD4 degradation in liver cancer through USP1.

name: ubiquitin specific peptidase 1
other_names: Ubiquitinyl hydrolase 1, Ubiquitin carboxyl-terminal hydrolase 1, ubiquitin thiolesterase 1

reactome.name: Recognition of DNA damage by PCNA-containing replication complex

wikipathways.name: miR-517 relationship with ARCN1 and USP1

summary: This gene encodes a member of the ubiquitin-specific processing (UBP) family of proteases that is a deubiquitinating enzyme (DUB) with His and Cys domains. This protein is located in the cytoplasm and cleaves the ubiquitin moiety from ubiquitin-fused precursors and ubiquitinylated proteins. The protein specifically deubiquitinates a protein in the Fanconi anemia (FA) DNA repair pathway. Alternate transcriptional splice variants have been characterized. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
